page.title: 15RAIKES HALL RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: When we interviewed Mr Hanson of Schole Brook farm he mentioned that he had recently purchased the nearby Raikes Hall farm where his wife and married daughter run a riding school. Mr Hanson describes the school as his cash crop, bringing in a regular income to replace the dairy herd. There are 40 horses and Mrs Hanson employs a fully qualified instructress. More adults than children use the stables and they are mainly professional and business people. Mrs Hanson also hires out three hackney carriages each pulled by two grey Welsh cobs,for weddings, and this employs the two sons and one extra man on Saturdays. Six donkeys are kept which compete in'Donkey Derbies' at local fetes.
